1 Corinthians__03.1: And I, brethren, could not speak to you as unto spiritual, but as unto carnal. As unto little ones in Christ.
1 Corinthians__03.2: I gave you milk to drink, not meat; for you were not able as yet. But neither indeed are you now able; for you are yet carnal.
1 Corinthians__03.3: For, whereas there is among you envying and contention, are you not carnal, and walk according to man?
1 Corinthians__03.4: For while one saith, I indeed am of Paul; and another, I am of Apollo; are you not men? What then is Apollo, and what is Paul?
1 Corinthians__03.5: The ministers of him whom you have believed; and to every one as the Lord hath given.
1 Corinthians__03.6: I have planted, Apollo watered, but God gave the increase.
1 Corinthians__03.7: Therefore, neither he that planteth is any thing, nor he that watereth; but God that giveth the increase.
1 Corinthians__03.8: Now he that planteth, and he that watereth, are one. And every man shall receive his own reward, according to his own labour.
1 Corinthians__03.9: For we are God's coadjutors: you are God's husbandry; you are God's building.
1 Corinthians__03.10: According to the grace of God that is given to me, as a wise architect, I have laid the foundation; and another buildeth thereon. But let every man take heed how he buildeth thereupon.
1 Corinthians__03.11: For other foundation no man can lay, but that which is laid; which is Christ Jesus.
1 Corinthians__03.12: Now if any man build <u>upon this foundation</u>, gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, stubble:
1 Corinthians__03.13: Every man's work shall be manifest; for the day of the Lord shall declare it, because it shall be revealed in fire; and the fire shall try every man's work, of what sort it is.
1 Corinthians__03.14: If any man's work abide, which he hath built thereupon, he shall receive a reward.
1 Corinthians__03.15: If any man's work burn, he shall suffer loss; but he himself shall be saved, yet so as by fire.
1 Corinthians__03.16: Know you not, that you are the temple of God, and that the Spirit of God dwelleth in you?
1 Corinthians__03.17: But if any man violate the temple of God, him shall God destroy. For the temple of God is holy, which you are.
1 Corinthians__03.18: Let no man deceive himself: if any man among you seem to be wise in this world, let him become a fool, that he may be wise.
1 Corinthians__03.19: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written: I will catch the wise in their own craftiness.
1 Corinthians__03.20: And again: The Lord knoweth the thoughts of the wise, that they are vain.
1 Corinthians__03.21: Let no man therefore glory in men.
1 Corinthians__03.22: For all things are yours, whether it be Paul, or Apollo, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things to come; for all are yours;
1 Corinthians__03.23: And you are Christ's; and Christ is God's.
